strings.Value: "Yes, we need to go and check on them."
"I'm sick and tired of these Skjegge. They may as well fall into the Abyss. â€“ I'm not helping them any more!"
"You are right. Let's go and see what happened."
{n}A strange golem enters your throne room. It is seriously hurt, barely moving its legs and swaying as if it's drunk.{/n} "Help... Us... H-Help... H-Help..."

{n}A frowning Harrim quickly responds.{/n} "How do you like that? Again, someone needs our help, and again it has to do with golems... Does any of this seem familiar, {Name}? Those simpletons from the Skjegge clan must have dug up something else. And got themselves into trouble again..."
{n}The priest's remarks are punctuated by a terrible clanging sound as the golem collapses on the floor in pieces.{/n}
"And I warned them they were wooing death. I warned them... Let's return to that little fortress that they couldn't get inside, and see what's happened to them this time!"
"Just don't go without me, all right? I want to see with my own eyes what catastrophe they've wrought this time, all the while praying to their {g|Torag}Torag{/g}."

"Yes, quite right... But on the other hand, you do know these treasure hunters were looking for trouble. What if they dug up some new golem as tall as a tower, and it's already on its way to destroy the capital? We should go and see. These are your lands, after all!"
"Hmm... Well, as you say, as you say."
